channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Abdelmalek Droukdel was a key Islamist fighter that France had been hunting for more than seven years.
item.title: France says its army killed al Qaeda North Africa chief

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Mass rallies are expected to sweep Australia today with tens of thousands planning to join the global Black Lives Matter protests and call for an end to Aboriginal deaths in custody.
item.title: George Floyd protests LIVE: Thousands join Black Lives Matter rallies in Victoria and QLD, as court overturns Sydney protest ban

item.description: Protesters have taken to the streets in Sydney.
item.title: Black Lives Matter, Sydney Protest

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Authorities are warning Australians not to take part in Black Lives Matter rallies planned across the country on Saturday, saying the risk of coronavirus spreading is too great.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 6.7 million as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: I fell hard and fast for a lanky bloke called Peter. Weâ€™d only known each other six weeks when we decided to get married. We had almost 28 years together.
item.title: The summer after my husband died, I learnt to swim. I was 56

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: The man was found on Friday and could not be revived. He was pronounced dead at hospital, the state's Department of Justice said in a statement.
item.title: Aboriginal prisoner, aged 40, dies after collapsing at Acacia Prison

item.description: The rally is to call for Australia to Stop Black Deaths in custody and to stand in solidarity with George Floyd and the Minneapolis freedom fighters for Black lives. Hosted by Warriors of the Aboriginal Resistance - WAR
item.title: Stop Black Deaths in Custody - Justice for George Floyd #BLM Rally : Melbourne

item.description: The Titans mentor admitted something had to give after they fell to their 14th straight loss stretching back to last season.
item.title: Holbrook explains dumping of big names as Titans look to avoid year without a win

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Melbourne Lord Mayor and Liberals want to know why an injecting centre is going next to iconic Queen Victoria Market
item.title: State government pressed for answers on site of new injecting room

item.description: Following Ohanian's post on Reddit, the company's Chief Executive Steve Huffman said the company would "honour" his request.
item.title: Reddit co-founder Ohanian resigns, wants black candidate to take over

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: With the season about to resume, the AFL is set to turn its attention to the future structure of pathway competitions and football departments.
item.title: NAB and Victorian state leagues await direction

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: The decision overturns a ruling, made on Friday night, declining to make that declaration.
item.title: Court of Appeal rules Sydney Black Lives Matter protest is authorised

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: The black athlete in Australia or America has to calibrate the risks, the pluses and minuses of taking a position, when considering a topic as literally flammable as the killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis.
item.title: Not Goodes: the hard choice facing footballers of colour

item.dc:creator: Phil Gould
item.description: There's a lot more to an NRL club than a head coach. So why are they always the first to go? Clubs need to take a good look at themselves before sacking the coach.
item.title: Why sacking the coach isn't always the solution

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Panthers rookie Matt Burton was down and out after last Sunday's draw with an undermanned Newcastle, But a club legend was waiting to lift him up.
item.title: Fittler reaches out to Panthers rookie Burton after drop-goal shocker

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Phil Davis says GWS have never been better placed for a tilt at the flag, and dismissed fears the club could become a victim of the financial crisis.
item.title: Giants vital to AFL being biggest code in country, says Davis

item.description: Lee Hsien-Loong issued an appeal for the two countries to find a way to cooperate rather than go down a divisive path that would lead to wider confrontation.
item.title: West has to make up with China, says Singapore PM

item.description: The country resumed top-flight soccer without social distancing measures or curbs on crowd sizes, owing to its success in combating the spread of the novel coronavirus.
item.title: Vietnam soccer league restarts in front of packed house

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Sydney's lightweight destroyer George Kambosos jnr knows the world will take notice if he secures a unification bout with Ukrainian superstar Vasyl Lomachenko.
item.title: 'Of course I'm the best': Sydney fighter on path for blockbuster world title bout

item.description: Police found 30 cannabis plants on Kennedy's back porch and 20.9 grams of dried cannabis inside his home in 2017. Kennedy said he was "just curious".
item.title: 'Wanted to see how they would grow': Former WA principal banned over cannabis

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Melbourne and Harley Bennell have invested in each other as the talented and resilient midfielder begins another phase of his footballing journey.
item.title: Chapter three for Harley: Bennell embraces Melbourne lifeline

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: He's on the Wallabies outer, but veteran Kurtley Beale still holds ambitions to join an elite club featuring on George Gregan and Adam Ashley-Cooper.
item.title: 'People would think Iâ€™m a long way off': Beale eyes 2023 World Cup

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: From jazz and gin to an art auction raising money for refugees and music from indie rocker Waxahatchee, we have your week covered.
item.title: Best of the week: What to see, hear and do in Sydney June 7-13

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: Each week we ask well-known Australian artists and entertainers to tell us what they are doing at home.
item.title: Home Sweet Home: how journalist Indira Naidoo is keeping busy

item.description: At some point over the past few years, Brooke Addamo â€“ AKA singer Owl Eyes â€“ came to a realisation about herself. And she's good with it.
item.title: 'When you're not cool, it takes so much pressure off': Owl Eyes

item.description: Under the cloud of a plague, somehow my parents are thriving.

item.description: Samples the judge had to view for sentencing purposes involved young boys aged five to 15 and covered "the full spectrum of depravity, he told the court.
item.title: 'Full spectrum of depravity': Court examines WA man's child porn collection

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: A $130,000 donation from a Melbourne businessman has saved a volunteer service that supports domestic violence victims in court.
item.title: Melbourne benefactor's 11th hour donation saves domestic violence service

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: Darebin's mayor says burning a wood fire at home is the same as throwing rubbish over a neighbour's fence.
item.title: Mayor calls for wood heater buy-back scheme as residents rage over suburban smoke

item.description: Crowds spilled from King George Square to neighbouring blocks, with people packing stairwells and balconies, brandishing signs calling for reform in Queensland and across the globe.
item.title: Thousands demand justice at Brisbane Black Lives Matter rally

item.description: On Friday the Newspaper Guild of Pittsburgh and many of her fellow reporters were demanding that Alexis Johnson be allowed cover the protests.
item.title: 'I am just ... wow': shouts of solidarity for black reporter pulled from protests

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Storm coach Craig Bellamy still wouldn't trade veteran skipper Cameron Smith for any other NRL hooker, while the team is looking for a new half-back for the next three weeks after Jahrome Hughes went down with a broken hand.
item.title: Smith at defensive best, Storm lose Hughes to injury

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Queensland authorities believe the state's latest COVID-19 case, a Melbourne fruit picker, may have been in contact with 50 Queenslanders since he arrived on Monday.
item.title: Melbourne man tests positive after flying to Brisbane, Bundaberg for work

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: While New Westralians declare themselves against foreign incursion, domestic insurgency, mercenary, treachery, sedition and treasonous behaviour, exactly where they stand on trespass and criminal damage is up in the air.
item.title: 'Let we forget': How Australia's latest micronation staged a coup that ended in court

item.description: Roosters skipper blamed wearing headphones for three of his teammates initially failing temperature checks before facing Brisbane.
item.title: Cordner plays down Roosters health scare, blames it on teammates wearing headphones
